links.title: Tesla preparing significant Autopilot upgrade, will use radar as 'primary sensor'
links.description: Tesla is preparing a significant upgrade to its autopilot technology for a future software update, the company announced today. The biggest change is in how the company uses its radar sensors. Previously, a camera and image processing system were the the primary sensors, backed up by data from the radar system to verify its findings - but going forward, the camera and radar will work side-by-side to detect obstacles.

links.title: Tesla says new Autopilot would likely have prevented fatality
links.description: Tesla Motors Co (TSLA.O) said on Sunday an update of its semi-autonomous driving system Autopilot would use advanced radar to improve its ability to prevent crashes and likely would have prevented a fatality of a driver using the system in May.

links.title: New Ford Everest catches fire, recall pending investigation | PerformanceDrive
links.description: Thinking of buying a brand new Ford Everest? You might want to think again. It seems the new SUV could have a tendency to spontaneously burst into flames. As was the case with this example while it was being test driven near Newcastle yesterday, spiking an investigation by Ford Australia which could lead to a major safety recall.

links.title: Chrysler issues recall because of combustion risk
links.description: An automatic feature on many SUVs is supposed to make drivers' lives easier, but there is a defect for some Chrysler drivers that could be causing spontaneous combustion in some vehicles. One local man's car erupted in flames. Robert Calabrese was enjoying sun and the sea air when he got a call telling him his Jeep was on fire.

links.title: Car appears to spontaneously combust in driveway of Salisbury Township home
links.description: SALISBURY TOWNSHIP - A car parked in the driveway of a Salisbury home seemed to spontaneously combust Tuesday morning. "I was just washing my garbage cans and I turned and I saw the car was on fire," said a neighbor who declined to provide a name.

links.title: Mazda NZ recalls 30,000 cars due to ignition fire fear
links.description: More than 30,000 Mazda cars are being recalled in New Zealand over fears the ignition could spontaneously catch fire. Mazda New Zealand was notified about the fault in October of last year but only issued the recall earlier this week.

links.title: Honda Recalls Fit and Vezel in Japan After Six Fire and Two Collision Reports
links.description: Japanese carmakers are universally renowned for manufacturing reliable automobiles. In the past decade or so, they have had their fair share of hits and misses. The worst offender is Honda, mainly because the company that gave us VTEC knew about the Takata airbag affair since 2009 but didn't do a damn thing to solve the problem.

links.title: A correction is coming, and nothing can stop it, this economist says
links.description: A sharp stock market pullback is imminent, according to David Rosenberg, chief economist and strategist at Gluskin Sheff. On Friday, stocks were hammered by fears the Federal Reserve might hike rates sooner than expected, sending the S&P 500 index and the Dow Jones industrial average into a tailspin.

messages.body: $TSLA Upgrading Autopilot: Seeing the World in Radar via @TeslaMotors  https://www.tesla.com/blog/upgrading-autopilot-seeing-world-radar/?utm_campaign=GL_Blog_091116&utm_source=Twitter&utm_medium=social

links.title: Upgrading Autopilot: Seeing the World in Radar
links.description: While there are dozens of small refinements with Version 8 of our software, described in addendum below, the most significant upgrade to Autopilot will be the use of more advanced signal processing to create a picture of the world using the onboard radar.
